programme.title: Stanley Tucci: Searching for Italy
programme.desc: Aired 5/15/2022. Stanley Tucci visits Umbria, nicknamed The Green Heart of Italy. While this small, predominantly rural region lives in the shadow of its more glamourous neighbor, Tuscany, Umbria has an ancient history that predates even the Romans. And, with the highest consumption of pork per capita, Umbria is a carnivore’s dream. From wild boar hunts to incredible black truffle farms, Stanley will explore the riches this land has to offer, while also questioning whether old traditions and centuries of religious orthodoxy are preventing younger generations from breaking through.

programme.title: Stanley Tucci: Searching for Italy
programme.desc: Aired 5/22/2022. Stanley Tucci sets out to explore how Italian immigration has transformed the food scene in his adopted hometown of London. Forget what you think you know about this city. London is a culinary mecca where Italian food from every region gets a chance to shine. The burrata is so creamy and pasta is so fresh that it may rival Italy itself. For over a century, Italians here have found inventive ways to create Italian food so good it’s enough to render Stanley speechless.

programme.title: Stanley Tucci: Searching for Italy
programme.desc: Aired 10/9/2022. Calabria is a region of rugged landscapes, dramatic mountain ranges, and some 500 miles of incredible coastline. Connected to Basilicata in the north and separated from Sicily in the south by the narrow Strait of Messina, Calabria is also the homeland of the Tucci family’s ancestors. In this episode, Stanley Tucci travels through the region, discovering the history of this beautiful and troubled place, as well as the history of his own family. Joined by his parents and reunited with Italian relatives, he reflects on the inspiration people draw from Calabria, and why those who leave this region feel compelled to return.

programme.title: Stanley Tucci: Searching for Italy
programme.desc: Aired 10/16/2022. In this episode, Stanley Tucci visits the Italian island of Sardinia. Famous for its harsh, rugged landscape, crystal blue ocean, and passionately preserved traditions, Tucci will learn how Sardinian food culture varies wildly throughout the island. He experiences the culinary delights of its coastal cities influenced by previous civilizations, and ventures inland to discover the rural heart of Sardinia, which remains untouched from outsider influence. This mysterious and mystical island is full of treasures and Sardinians are proud of their heritage and culinary diversity. One thing is certain: whoever steps foot on this island, will never want to leave.

programme.title: Stanley Tucci: Searching for Italy
programme.desc: Aired 10/23/2022. In this episode, Stanley Tucci visits Puglia, a region famous for its fragrant olive oil, beautiful vegetables, cheeses, and durum wheat. Despite being such a fertile region, Puglia is also one of Italy's poorest and Tucci discovers how today’s spirit of innovation was forged out of hard times. From Bari’s raw seafood to Cisternino’s Fornelli and Foggia’s burnt grain to cheesemaker Vito’s Apulian blue cheeses, it is clear that by reclaiming their past, the Pugliese are taking ownership of their past and embracing the future on their own terms.

programme.title: Stanley Tucci: Searching for Italy
programme.desc: Aired 10/30/2022. In this episode, Stanley Tucci visits one of the most famous and frequented regions of Italy – the Italian Riviera – which is famous for the glitz and glamour of Portofino and stunning picture-perfect fishing villages of the Cinque Terre. Liguria is a thin strip of mountainous land, sandwiched between the Alps and Apennines, and lined with rugged scenery and stunning coastal views. The capital of Genoa, once a wealthy merchant empire, offers a richness of cuisine fit for a prince from personalized stamped pasta to its most internationally acclaimed export, Genoese pesto. Tucci will discover how Ligurians have learned to adapt to life in this difficult landscape and how they have found ingenious solutions to survive frugally yet thrive.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown
programme.desc: Aired 05/31/15. Anthony Bourdain travels to his childhood home state with his brother Chris, where they rekindle memories at the classic roadside joint, Hiram’s.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown
programme.desc: Aired 06/07/15. Bourdain explores the beauty, culture, and food of Budapest, where he samples goulash, fisherman's soup, blood sausage, and chicken liver.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown
programme.desc: Aired 06/14/15. There’s another side to Hawaii that many tourists don’t know about. Go with Anthony Bourdain as he explores the unknown area.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown
programme.desc: Aired 06/21/15. Anthony Bourdain travels to Beirut, where he discovers a beautiful country known for its vibrant nightlife and legendary cuisine.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown
programme.desc: Aired 10/25/2015. Anthony Bourdain visits Addis Ababa, to sample dishes like injera bread and soak up Ethiopian melodies with chef Marcus Samuelsson.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown
programme.desc: Aired 04/13/2014. Anthony Bourdain soaks up all Amritsar has to offer. Go with him as he samples savory delicacies at roadside restaurants and experiences a Gurpurab festival.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown
programme.desc: Aired 04/13/2014. Anthony Bourdain soaks up all Amritsar has to offer. Go with him as he samples savory delicacies at roadside restaurants and experiences a Gurpurab festival.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown
programme.desc: Aired 04/20/2014. Anthony Bourdain travels to Las Vegas with food author Michael Ruhlman, where they explore sites including Huntridge Tavern.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown
programme.desc: Aired 04/27/2014. Anthony Bourdain accompanies world-renowned chef Daniel Boulud as they travel back to his hometown of Lyon, France.

programme.title: This Is Life with Lisa Ling
programme.desc: Aired 10/1/2017. Lisa Ling goes on a journey through the scintillating worlds of Tantra and surrogate partner therapy in search of sexual healing.

programme.title: This Is Life with Lisa Ling
programme.desc: Aired 10/8/2017. Lisa explores the massive and economically diverse movement of immigration from China to the United States – and traces her own family roots, to find out what it means to be Chinese in America.

programme.title: This Is Life with Lisa Ling
programme.desc: Aired 10/15/2017. In this episode, Lisa explores the legal and social consequences of convicting adolescents and young adults of sex offenses – when does teenage sexuality cross the line and become a crime?

programme.title: This Is Life with Lisa Ling
programme.desc: Aired 10/22/2017. As the divide between right and left reaches new heights, one group is taking an extreme approach to politics: The Patriot Movement. Lisa embeds with a militia deep in the Arizona desert preparing for threats foreign and domestic and meets the family of a man who became a martyr for the movement.

programme.title: This Is Life with Lisa Ling
programme.desc: Aired 10/29/2017. Contrary to what many might think, Islam is far from new to America. Lisa meets 3 very different African American Muslims and learns about the power of Islam to reshape lives in the black community, a community that can trace its connection to Islam back to the very first days of slavery.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown
programme.desc: Aired 05/04/2014. Anthony Bourdain travels to Mexico City, Oaxaca and Cuernavaca, Mexico, where residents express their passion through food and art.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown
programme.desc: Aired 04/13/2014. Anthony Bourdain soaks up all Amritsar has to offer. Go with him as he samples savory delicacies at roadside restaurants and experiences a Gurpurab festival.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown
programme.desc: Aired 04/20/2014. Anthony Bourdain travels to Las Vegas with food author Michael Ruhlman, where they explore sites including Huntridge Tavern.

programme.title: This Is Life with Lisa Ling
programme.desc: Aired 11/5/2017. Polygamy in America used to be known as something that’s practiced solely in Mormon country, but thanks to a growing crop of unorthodox dating websites there’s a new spin on multiple marriage, one that is spreading far beyond Utah. Lisa meets open minded singles, couples and throuples who believe that love doesn’t always come in pairs.

programme.title: This Is Life with Lisa Ling
programme.desc: Aired 11/19/2017. Every year millions flock to Las Vegas trying to fulfill a dream and win big, but outside and even underground is another world that couldn't be more different. Lisa Ling investigates the dark, shocking and sometimes dangerous underbelly of Sin City that few get to see.

programme.title: This Is Life with Lisa Ling
programme.desc: Aired 11/26/2017. In this episode, Lisa takes a revealing look inside the exciting, emotional competition that is the world's most prestigious transgender beauty pageant.

programme.title: This Is Life with Lisa Ling
programme.desc: Aired 10/1/2017. Lisa Ling goes on a journey through the scintillating worlds of Tantra and surrogate partner therapy in search of sexual healing.
